channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Middle East Crisis Updates: Gaza Cease-Fire to Start on Sunday, Mediator Says
item.description: The Israeli cabinet still has to ratify the deal, and some details remained unresolved. President Biden said hostages were to be released over 42 days...

item.title: On TikTok, Users Thumb Their Noses at Looming Ban
item.description: Ahead of a Supreme Court ruling, they are mocking U.S. national security concerns about the Chinese-owned app.

item.title: Brad Pitt slams ‘awful’ AI scammers who faked relationship to convince French woman to send them $855,000
item.description: A French women was duped out of $855,000 by an AI-generated Brad Pitt. Now, the actor is warning fans not to respond to unsolicited online outreach.

item.title: Former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro Looks to Trump and the U.S. to Avoid Prison

item.title: Keir Starmer Vows Long-Term U.K. Partnership With Ukraine on Kyiv Visit
item.description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer signaled continued solidarity, with further U.S. support in question under a second Trump administration.

item.title: Azerbaijan’s Leader, Emboldened, Picks a Rare Fight With Putin

item.title: A Cease-Fire in Gaza
item.description: Israel and Hamas have finally agreed to a truce.

item.title: Cartier owner Richemont shines with better-than-expected sales as poor China demand offset by rest of the world
item.description: Despite weakness in China, "Richemont has never been stronger," investment firm Vontobel's analyst said.

item.title: Volkswagen CFO delivers broadside to unproductive workers as China emerges as a potential buyer of factories
item.description: Volkswagen CFO Arno Antlitz said the carmaker wouldn't invest in unproductive factories, paving way for new battle with workers.
